explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 74degC (open cup flash test) (NFPA (13th, 2002)), which is classified into "Category 4."

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2522) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2522) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2522) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 1,550mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,751mg/kg, 2,659mg/kg and 1,550mg/kg (SIDS (2003)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation) value of 0.62mg/L (equivalent to 95ppm) (SIDS (2003)) was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (2,480ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 250Pa (20degC), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (SIDS (2003)): "Severe erythema, edema and necrosis were observed immediately post-dosing. These symptoms persisted for 72 hours. The present substance was thus considered to have a potential for skin corrosivity." Although classified into Category 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (SIDS (2003)): "within 2 hours of application, all treated animals exhibited severe corneal, iris and conjunctival damage. The present substance was thus considered to have a potential for eye corrosivity."

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests performed in accordance with OECD 605 (SIDS (2003)): "There was no evidence of skin reactions induced by sensitization," "Negative." Also based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests evaluated according to Maximization Method (CERI Hazard Data 2001-55 (2002)): "No evidence of sensitization."

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1998), SIDS (2003) and CERI Hazard Data 2001-55 (2002).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of underfeeding of the offspring probably due to impaired nursing functions of maternal animals (though maternal behaviours were observed) and increased neonatal mortality at doses producing parental toxicity, described in Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1998), CERI Hazard Data 2001-55 (2002) and SIDS (2003).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "reduced locomotor activity and sedation" (SIDS (2003)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 72 hours ErC50=9mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals, 1997).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (it was hydrolyzed to methacrylic acid (the decomposition by BOD: 91%) and to N,N-dimethyl-N-ethanolamine (the decomposition by BOD: 60.5%) (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.97 (PHYSPROP Database (2005))), it was claasified into Not classified.
